column4: how do i update my ubuntu 10.04 kernel to 2.6.34? i need it for driver support.
I think the only option you have is to compile manually.
thats what i tried and failed
can i pin the package using the 10.10 repo?
I don't know if that's a good idea...
i don't think its been tried before
It might be better to manually download and install only the packages you need rather than add the whole repo.
thats an interesting idea, from packages.ubuntu.com 10.10?
You will probably have a little bit of dependency hell to work through though.
as long as its documented errors i'll be okay, thanks undecim
can i get it from the alternative 10.10 disk for my arch?
Ubuntu should automatically detect that the disk has packages
If you run "sudo add-apt-repository ppa:leannogasawara/ppa" you should have those upgrades available.
okay, thanks, that will save me much work
downloading now, should work great, thanks for saving me much time
